titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wilhelm Flügge Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Correspondence, manuscripts, papers, lectures, minutes, memoranda, photographs, and teaching materials relating to his research, teaching, departmental matters, conferences, and other professional concerns. Includes manuscript of his book STRESSES IN SHELLS. His other research subjects include aerodynamics and structural engineering.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Wilhelm Flügge Papers (SC0384). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Professor emeritus of Applied Mechanics, Flügge first came to Stanford University in 1948. He held a Fulbright Scholarship during the 1966-67 academic year and in 1970 was awarded the Theodore V. Karman Medal by the American Society of Civil Engineers.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, papers, lectures, minutes, memoranda, photographs, and teaching materials relating to his research, teaching, departmental matters, conferences, and other professional concerns. Includes manuscript of his book STRESSES IN SHELLS. His other research subjects include aerodynamics and structural engineering.

controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Department of Mechanical Engineering. Faculty.

Mechanical engineering.

did.unittitle: Proof copy of Viscoelasticity by Flugge (Blaisdell Publishing Co. 1967) with annotations
Third printing of Stresses in Shells by Flugge (Springer-Verlag New York Inc. 1966) with many corrections
